intro: Pavetta gleniei, commonly known as the African bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in coastal areas and has a preference for sandy or gravelly soils. Pavetta gleniei is often used in ornamental horticulture due to its attractive blooms and adaptability to various environmental conditions.
